name: Trazodone Hydrochloride

ingredients.name: SODIUM STARCH GLYCOLATE TYPE A POTATO

indications.text: trazodone hydrochloride tablets indicated treatment major depressive disorder ( mdd ) adults .

contraindications.text: starting dose : 150 mg divided doses daily . may increased 50 mg per day every three four days . maximum dose : 400 mg per day divided doses ( 2 ) . trazodone hydrochloride tablets taken shortly meal light snack ( 2 ) . tablets swallowed whole broken half along score line , chewed crushed ( 2 ) . discontinued , gradual dose reduction recommended ( 2 ) .

warningsAndPrecautions: trazodone hydrochloride tablets , usp available follows : 50 mg : white , round , compressed tablet , debossed “ pliva 433 ” one side scored side . available ndc : 70518-2929-00 ndc : 70518-2929-01 ndc : 70518-2929-02 ndc : 70518-2929-03 ndc : 70518-2929-04 ndc : 70518-2929-05 ndc : 70518-2929-06 ndc : 70518-2929-07 packaging : 30 1 blister pack packaging : 90 1 bottle plastic packaging : 30 1 blister pack packaging : 90 1 bottle plastic packaging : 60 1 blister pack packaging : 100 1 box packaging : 1 1 pouch packaging : 30 1 bottle plastic directions using correct score breaking tablet please refer following : - 50 mg , break score either left right side tablet ( one-third tablet ) . store 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . dispense tight , light-resistant container defined usp . keep medications reach children . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: trazodone hydrochloride tablets contraindicated : patients taking , within 14 days stopping , monoamine oxidase inhibitors ( maois ) , including maois linezolid intravenous methylene blue , increased risk serotonin syndrome [ ( 5.2 ) , ( 7.1 ) ] .
indications_original: Trazodone hydrochloride tablets are indicated for the treatment of major depressive disorder (MDD) in adults.
contraindications_original: Starting dose: 150 mg in divided doses daily. May be increased by 50 mg per day every three to four days. Maximum dose: 400 mg per day in divided doses ( 2 ). Trazodone hydrochloride tablets should be taken shortly after a meal or light snack ( 2 ). Tablets should be swallowed whole or broken in half along the score line, and should not be chewed or crushed ( 2 ). When discontinued, gradual dose reduction is recommended ( 2 ).
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Trazodone hydrochloride tablets, USP are available as follows:
                  50 mg: White, round, compressed tablet, debossed “PLIVA 433” on one side and scored on the other side. Available in
                  NDC: 70518-2929-00
                  NDC: 70518-2929-01
                  NDC: 70518-2929-02
                  NDC: 70518-2929-03
                  NDC: 70518-2929-04
                  NDC: 70518-2929-05
                  NDC: 70518-2929-06
                  NDC: 70518-2929-07
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 90 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 90 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 60 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 100 in 1 BOX
                  PACKAGING: 1 in 1 POUCH
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC 
                  
                  
                  Directions for using the correct score when breaking the tablet please refer to the following:
                  - For 50 mg, break the score on either the left or right side of the tablet (one-third of a tablet).
                  
                  Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container as defined in the USP.
                  KEEP THIS AND ALL MEDICATIONS OUT OF THE REACH OF CHILDREN.
                  
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions_original:
Trazodone hydrochloride tablets are contraindicated in:
                  
                     
                        Patients taking, or within 14 days of stopping, monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOIs), including MAOIs such as linezolid or intravenous methylene blue, because of an increased risk of serotonin syndrome 
         
   
    [see Warnings and Precautions (
          
    
     5.2), Drug Interactions (
          
    
     7.1)].
